title: Police Misuse / पुलिस एफआईआर दर्ज नहीं कर रही / ਪੁਲਿਸ FIR ਨਹੀਂ ਲੈਂਦੀ
question: Police refused to register my FIR, what can I do?
text: If police refuse to file an FIR, you can send a written complaint to the Superintendent of Police under Section 154(3) CrPC or approach Magistrate under Section 156(3).
steps: Ask for written reason of refusal.
Send complaint to SP by post or email.
If ignored, approach Magistrate.

title: Property Dispute / संपत्ति विवाद / ਜਾਇਦਾਦ ਵਿਵਾਦ
question: Neighbour encroached my land, what can I do?
text: You can file a civil suit for possession and injunction under the Civil Procedure Code and approach local revenue officer for boundary verification.
steps: Collect land papers and site photos.
Consult Tehsildar or a civil lawyer.
File suit in civil court for possession or injunction.

title: Domestic Violence / घरेलू हिंसा / ਘਰੇਲੂ ਹਿੰਸਾ
question: How can I file a complaint for domestic violence?
text: Under the Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act 2005, women facing abuse can seek protection, residence, and maintenance orders.
law_reference: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act 2005
steps: Go to nearest police station or Protection Officer.
Write complaint with details of abuse.
Court can issue protection and residence order.

title: Dowry Harassment / दहेज उत्पीड़न / ਦਹੇਜ ਉਤਪੀੜਨ
question: My husband is demanding dowry, what can I do?
text: Dowry harassment is a criminal offence under Section 498A IPC. Police must register FIR against husband or relatives for cruelty or dowry demand.
steps: Collect proof of harassment like messages or witnesses.
Submit written complaint to police or Women Cell.
If ignored, call 181 or approach NCW.

title: Cyber Fraud / साइबर ठगी / ਸਾਇਬਰ ਠੱਗੀ
question: Someone used my ATM card online.
text: Cyber fraud cases fall under Sections 66C and 66D of the IT Act 2000. Victims should report within 24 hours for best recovery chance.
steps: Call 1930 or report at cybercrime.gov.in immediately.
Inform your bank to block card or account.
Keep complaint number for tracking investigation.

title: Traffic Challan / ट्रैफिक चालान / ਟਰੈਫਿਕ ਚਾਲਾਨ
question: I received a wrong e-challan.
text: You can dispute a wrong traffic challan through your state transport website or visit the nearest RTO office.
steps: Check challan details on official traffic site.
Upload proof like GPS or payment records.
File an online or written grievance.

title: Child Labour / बाल श्रम / ਬਾਲ ਸ਼ਰਮ
question: A child is working in a factory.
text: Employment of children below 14 years is banned under the Child Labour (Prohibition and Regulation) Act 1986.
steps: Call 1098 or inform police.
Provide address and photos.
Cooperate with rescue officers.

title: Senior Citizen Abuse / वरिष्ठ नागरिक उत्पीड़न / ਵਰਿਸ਼ਠ ਨਾਗਰਿਕ ਉਤਪੀੜਨ
question: Family is harassing senior citizen.
text: Under the Senior Citizens Act 2007, elders can claim maintenance and protection from abuse.
steps: Call 14567 or visit social welfare office.
File complaint for protection or maintenance.
Tribunal may order monthly support.

title: Right to Information / सूचना अधिकार / ਸੂਚਨਾ ਅਧਿਕਾਰ
question: How to file an RTI application?
text: Under the RTI Act 2005, any citizen can seek information from public authorities by paying ₹10 fee.
steps: Address to Public Information Officer.
Attach ₹10 fee or IPO.
Submit by post or online.

title: Free Legal Aid / निःशुल्क कानूनी सहायता / ਮੁਫ਼ਤ ਕਾਨੂੰਨੀ ਮਦਦ
question: Where can I get free legal help?
text: Under the Legal Services Authorities Act 1987, women, children, SC/ST, and low-income citizens are entitled to free legal representation.
steps: Call 15100 or visit District Legal Services Authority (DLSA).
Submit ID and income proof.
Free lawyer will be assigned for your case.

title: Caste Discrimination / जाति भेदभाव / ਜਾਤੀ ਭੇਦਭਾਵ
question: Faced caste discrimination, what law protects me?
text: SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act 1989 protects against caste-based abuse and violence.
steps: Write complaint with details.
Approach police or SC/ST Commission.
Seek free legal aid.

title: Right to Education / शिक्षा का अधिकार / ਸਿੱਖਿਆ ਦਾ ਅਧਿਕਾਰ
question: How can I claim free education for my child?
text: The Right to Education Act 2009 guarantees free and compulsory education to children between 6 and 14 years of age.
steps: Visit local government school or education officer.
Submit child’s age and residence proof.
File grievance if admission denied.

title: Right to Equality / समानता का अधिकार / ਸਮਾਨਤਾ ਦਾ ਅਧਿਕਾਰ
question: What is the Right to Equality?
text: Articles 14 to 18 of the Indian Constitution guarantee equality before law, prohibit discrimination, and abolish untouchability and titles.
steps: If discriminated, approach Human Rights Commission.
File complaint with police under SC/ST Act if caste based.
Seek free legal aid support.

title: Right to Privacy / निजता का अधिकार / ਗੋਪਨੀਯਤਾ ਦਾ ਅਧਿਕਾਰ
question: My private photos were leaked online.
text: Right to privacy is a fundamental right under Article 21. Cyber offences like photo misuse are punishable under IT Act 2000 Sections 66E & 67.
steps: Report at cybercrime.gov.in or call 1930 within 24 hours.
Provide screenshots and URLs as evidence.
Request takedown from social media platforms.

title: Women Safety / महिला सुरक्षा / ਮਹਿਲਾ ਸੁਰੱਖਿਆ
question: Someone is stalking or threatening me.
text: Stalking and harassment are offences under Sections 354D and 506 IPC. Police must register FIR immediately.
steps: Call 181 or 112 for immediate help.
File FIR mentioning details of threat or messages.
Keep copies of complaint and FIR for follow-up.
